alert.note: Alert for Garland; Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:09PM CDT until April 20 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL GARLAND, WEST CENTRAL LONOKE, CENTRAL PULASKI AND CENTRAL SALINE COUNTIES... At 909 PM CDT, While widespread rain had mostly ended from Hot Springs to Lonsdale, showers and thunderstorms continued farther east from Benton to Little Rock and Lonoke. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in some areas, with flash flooding likely. Roads were reportedly under water just south of Alexander, and vehicles were stranded. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Rock, North Little Rock, Hot Springs, Benton, Sherwood, Jacksonville, West Little Rock, Maumelle, Bryant, Hot Springs Village, Downtown Little Rock, Lonoke, Southwest Little Rock, North Little Rock Airport, Shannon Hills, Wrightsville, Argenta, Mountain Pine, Keo and Lonsdale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
